newsitem.title: UK: Copper to slide to new low of $1,612 - Waterside.
newsitem.headline: Copper to slide to new low of $1,612 - Waterside.

text.p: Copper prices will break their June low of $1,745 a tonne, sliding over the next few months to the 1993 low of $1,612, Waterside Futures said on Tuesday.
A rally from the June low to a high of $2,160 in September contained an Elliot Wave pattern that indicated a counter-trend formation, Waterside said in its latest Wavetrack report.
"Quite simply, that indicates that the downtrend...is incomplete and that a price decline below $1,745 will occur during the next few months," it said.
"An absolute low is forecast towards $1,612, which is the mainstream support last traded in October 1993."
An alternate scenario also sees copper falling toward $1,612, but expects prices to first rally to $2,092.

In this case, a much larger triangle trading range would be formed, with prices declining in the short term to $1,915, followed by two strong advances to $1,990 and $2,050 before heading down again to the 1993 nadir.
Aluminium is seen most likely rising to $1,387 over the next week or two, then declining to $1,287 and $1,254.
Earlier, it had appeared that prices were beginning an advance from its October 10 low of $1,304 to targets around $1,544.

"This has not happened. In fact, each advance from $1,304 has been followed by deep retracements of the gains, which is typical behaviour in a counter-trend advance where the larger trend is downwards," the report said.
